List Central Credits

0 points

  •  
  •  
  •  
  •  
  •  
  •  
0.00 from 0 votes

Created: Mar. 22nd, 2010

List Central uses many tools and components from o

Tags:

 

  • mooTools

    Via digitarald

    List Central proudly uses mooTools as it's Javascript framework.

  • Multibox for mooTools 1.2

    Multibox is the nifty image slide show that List Central uses. Liam Smart cleaned up Multibox to work with mooTools 1.2, which enabled List Central to use it.

  • OpenJS Keyboard Shortcuts

    Via Book Glutton

    The Javascript used to make the few List Central keyboards shortcuts work was provided by the good folk over at OpenJS.

  • CKEditor

    The WYSIWYG (What you see is what you get) editor is a limited version of CKEditor, a very powerful, all Javascript, web editor.

  • Ajaxload

    Via cybernetzblog

    The primary List Cenral ajax loading graphic was generrated by Ajaxload. List Central needs several loading images, one for each available theme, and Ajaxload's quick and easy interface made their creation a simple task.

  • Flickr's API

    Flickr's API gives List Central easy access into their Creative Commons pool, so that you can easily jazz up your lists with images.

  • Amazon Associates, and the Amazon Product Advertising API

    Amazon's affiliate program offers a Product Advertising API that List Central uses to give you the ability to add items from the Amazon catalog to your lists. The links generated from the Amazon API are affiliates links that List Central earns a commission from.

  • Failblog

    Via Jackson-West

    The fine folks at the FAILblog were kind enough to let List Central use pictures from their FAIL library on our error pages. So when List Central messes up, you will get a side of funny with our FAIL.

  • 3D Tag Cloud

    List Central uses the flash file from the Wordpress plugin WP Cumulous for the 3D tag cloud you can see on the front page. With the help of RoyTanck.com we were able to repurpose the flash from the plugin to use it on List Central. Thanks goes to both the people behind WP Cumulous and Roy Tanck.

  • Gravatar

    Via Web-Doctype

    List Central provides Gravatar as an option for you to use instead of uploading an avatar.

  • reCAPTCHA

    Via heyennovy

    List Central uses reCAPTCHA on its sign up form. reCAPTCHA is the only way that you help transcribe old books while proving that you are human on the Internet. It is really quite ingenious.

  • Google Apps

    List Central is very grateful for the complementart apps suite we use for email, documents, and web analytics. We love Google!

  • Debian

    Via fcestrada

    List Central runs on a Debian server, which is by far my favourite flavour of Linux.

  • mod_perl

    mod_perl unites the perl programming language with the apache web server to give List Central power and efficiency.

  • Apache 2

    List Central is served from the web's most popular web server, Apache!
